meanings: (쓰레기 등을) throw away, throw out, dump, (informal) junk
(포기하다, 떠나다) desert, leave, abandon, (literary) forsake, give up
at the cost of one´s life

vlive.korean: [습관 못 버리고 팀킬의 길로...] [Couldn't help but take the path of losing the game for the team...] View video TOMORROW X TOGETHER : TO DO X TOMORROW X TOGETHER 2020 - EP.7
vlive.english: [Couldn't help but take the path of losing the game for the team...]

vlive.english: Did you scrap your junk car?

vlive.korean: 이 변태들 다 죽여버리고 싶어! These perverts. I want to kill you all! 듣기 View video 컨스TV : 니들 나한테 용사따윈 바라지 마라![넘버식스]ep8.
vlive.english: These perverts. I want to kill you all!

vlive.korean: [두 사람의 심각한 입맛 동기화] 뭔가 파를 버리고 마늘 가져올 것 같다고... [Synchronized perfectly] I thought he would bring crushed garlic instead of leeks. 듣기 View video TOMORROW X TOGETHER : TO DO X TOMORROW X TOGETHER 2020 - EP.4
vlive.english: [Synchronized perfectly] I thought he would bring crushed garlic instead of leeks.

vlive.korean: 물은 이렇게 버리고? After taking out the water? 듣기 View video NU'EST : [NU’EST] 쩨-하🤗

examples.korean: The house was now a shell gutted by flames. 듣기 Add to Wordbook 그 집은 이제 화마에 속이 다 타 버리고 뼈대만 남아 있었다. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: The house was now a shell gutted by flames. Add to Wordbook

examples.korean: I’d kill him for two pins. 듣기 Add to Wordbook 그 놈을 확 죽여 버리고 싶어. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: I’d kill him for two pins. Add to Wordbook

examples.korean: He longed to throw off the mask of respectability. 듣기 Add to Wordbook 그는 체면이라는 가면을 벗어 던져 버리고 싶은 마음이 간절했다. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: He longed to throw off the mask of respectability. Add to Wordbook

examples.korean: She was deserted by her husband. 듣기 Add to Wordbook 남편은 그녀를 버리고 도망쳤다 Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: She was deserted by her husband. Add to Wordbook

examples.korean: Don’t leave me here, I beg of you! 듣기 Add to Wordbook 날 여기 버리고 가지 말아요. 애원이에요! Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
